image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks in a hat and sunglasses surrounded by Indigenous men in red garb and body paint.

props.synopsis: At the first Garma Festival since the defeat of the Voice referendum, Anthony Albanese will say his government remains "committed to Makarrata" as it beats a new path on Indigenous affairs.

title.children: Albanese points to 'best chance Australia has ever had' for Indigenous self-determination

image.altText: A woman wearing a cap stands in front of palm trees

props.synopsis: Tess Ingram was part of a UNICEF convoy that came under fire just one week after Zomi Frankcom was killed, and says the system to protect aid workers is not working, and promised changes have not been made.

title.children: Australian aid worker says lack of progress in the wake of Zomi Frankcom's death is 'disappointing'

image.altText: NT Police Minister Brent Potter standing outside NT Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has announced it has identified issues with the enforcement of fines and penalties, dating back at least a decade.

title.children: 'Monumental stuff-up': Enforcement of NT unpaid fines dating back a decade could be unlawful

image.altText: gioldoglodgold

props.synopsis: Australia has won three gold medals in a stunning morning at the Paris Olympics, with victories in the pool to Cam McEvoy and Kaylee McKeown, and an historic BMX win for Saya Sakakibara.

title.children: Australian gold rush in Paris as McEvoy, McKeown and Sakakibara create history at the Olympics

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BMX Racing: Saya Sakakibara wins gold!!!
Swimming: McKeown, Ramsay qualify for 200m IM final

image.altText: A huge sign with Haniyeh's face is shown behind a crowd of armed men waving yellow flags

props.synopsis: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was possibly killed by a bomb planted in his room months in advance, with reports suggesting Israeli intelligence could be behind the plan.

title.children: Three assassinations later, how has Israel targeted its enemies?

image.altText: an aerial shot of a centre-pivot growing green grass surrounded by red soil.

props.synopsis: A new water plan for the Western Davenport, quietly released by the NT government, has reduced groundwater available for extraction and also cut allocations for Aboriginal economic development.

title.children: New NT water plan reduces available extraction by 50 per cent

image.altText: A man and a woman, both middle-aged and Indigenous, stand outside a hospital emergency department.

props.synopsis: There is a desperate need for organ donation in the Northern Territory, but Aboriginal health workers say it can be a difficult topic to talk about.

title.children: In many Aboriginal communities, organ donation can be 'taboo'. These health workers are trying to change that

image.altText: Michael Gunner, his deputy Nicole Manison and other members of his team smile and laugh after winning the election.

props.synopsis: It was a very different Northern Territory in 2016 when Labor rose to power in a monumental election victory. Later this month, the party's complicated legacy in government will be judged by voters – and the election is tipped to be a nailbiter.

title.children: Territory Labor swept into power with an electoral landslide. Eight years later, this is its legacy

image.altText: Man embraces older woman on the tarmac. Both smiling

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has welcomed home the three Americans who were sentenced to years in Russian penal colonies after secret "sham" trials and now free under a major East-West prisoner swap.

title.children: Alliances 'stepped up' and 'took a chance': Biden and Harris meet with prisoners released by Russia

image.altText: Dyson Daniels of Australia holds his knee after slipping on the court.

props.synopsis: The Boomers are through to the men's basketball quarterfinals after results go their way, while the Stingers and Gangurrus are assured of advancing from the group stage after their respective wins in the women's water polo and 3x3 basketball.

title.children: Boomers avoid early Games exit, Stingers earn quarterfinal berth with win over Canada

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has filed a court application to appoint Victorian barrister Mark Irving and a team of assistant administrators to clean up the beleaguered organisation.

title.children: Fair Work Commission moves to appoint CFMEU administrator

image.altText: Kamala Harris, wearing a light blue suit, walks up an aircraft staircase and waves.

props.synopsis: Two weeks since Trump narrowly avoided assassination, the race for the White House is up-ended — and the Republican contender has long abandoned his short-lived shift to a "nice" tone.

title.children: As Trump questions Harris's racial identity, Democrats are trying a simple message: He and Vance are 'weird'

image.altText: Steven May is helped off the ground by a trainer

props.synopsis: Melbourne is sweating on scans on Steven May's ribs after the star defender was forced out of Friday night's horror loss to the Western Bulldogs in the second quarter.

title.children: Melbourne star Steven May sent to hospital after 'incredibly disappointing' loss to Western Bulldogs

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: After 11 tries, 74 points, a sin bin and some moments of Sam Walker brilliance, the Roosters snuck home 40-34 against the Dolphins in Perth.

title.children: Sam Walker dazzles as Roosters sneak home against Dolphins in 74-point thriller

image.altText: NDIS minister BIll Shorten.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of participants and businesses that are part of the National Disability Insurance Scheme should be subject to a tiered, risk-proportionate registration process, a government-appointed taskforce recommends.

title.children: It split the disability community — and now we have more information on one of the most controversial areas of NDIS reform

image.altText: 5qhmurray

props.synopsis: It was another golden day in the pool for Australia, but plenty happening throughout the Paris Olympics that you might not have seen on the TV. Here's today's quick hits from the Games.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Daggy dad goes viral, Murray's cheeky tweet, and sponsor gets tongues wagging

image.altText: A close up of the front of a small plane with a sunset behind

props.synopsis: Rex knew it was being ambitious when it expanded into capital city services after Virgin Australia found itself in trouble in 2020. Little did it know that four years later, Virgin would be the very company coming to its aid.

title.children: Rex Airlines went from business as usual to having its wings clipped by administrators in less than a week

image.altText: croweater on hill

props.synopsis: Australia joins the list of worldwide locations where Active Clubs have been established. Experts say white supremacy groups like this are a threat to our social cohesion.

title.children: Extremist groups known as Active Clubs have infiltrated Australia, preying on young men and shape shifting to avoid detection

image.altText: A view of the coast in Beirut during summer time, which shows a bleu beach and greenery.

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon say they've been left "stranded" trying to exit Lebanon amid renewed advice from the federal government to evacuate the country. But many say they've been left in the dark after being told the airport is closed.

title.children: 'Stranded' Australians holidaying in Lebanon say they can't get home amid evacuation orders

image.altText: A man stands in a glass box as people take photos of him.

props.synopsis: One of the largest and most complex prisoner swaps since the Cold War was almost derailed by a shocking death, competing global agendas, and a US president's fading political ambitions.

title.children: A hit man, a shock death, and 18 months of secrecy: How the Russia-prisoner swap quietly unfolded

image.altText: Mobile phone tower

props.synopsis: With nearly 200,000 Australians relying on 3G coverage, rural residents are especially concerned they will be left without mobile service if the shutdown proceeds.

title.children: Senate committee recommends delay to 3G shutdown as mobile users fear loss of coverage

image.altText: 2024-07-31T163618Z_1384351195_UP1EK7V1A4DST_RTRMADP_3_OLYMPICS-2024-CANOESLALOM (1)

props.synopsis: From the pool to River Seine, see the magical moments for athletes from week one of the Games.

title.children: The most stunning images from the 2024 Paris Olympics

image.altText: Fighters in camouflage stand in front of a coffin with a large picture of Fuad Shukr displayed on the wall behind

props.synopsis: The leader of Lebanese militant group Hezbollah warns that the conflict with Israel is in a "new phase", as he addresses mourners at the funeral of a commander from the group who was killed by an Israeli air strike this week in Beirut.

title.children: Hezbollah leader says war with Israel has entered 'new phase' after killings of top militant figures

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man in a gingham shirt

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny, the fiercest political foe of Russian President Vladimir Putin, died in February in an Arctic penal colony while serving a 19-year sentence on extremism charges.

title.children: Former Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was meant to be included in prisoner swap

image.altText: Rex Airlines logo on the fuselage of one of its aircraft, 2007

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Rex Airlines employees have been officially let go from the regional carrier after receiving formal notices of termination.

title.children: Hundreds of Rex Airlines staff notified of termination after carrier enters voluntary administration

image.altText: PinkPantheress sits side on in a room with dark blue curtains and leopard print wall

props.synopsis: "I will not be able to continue with the rest of my live shows this year in order to focus on my physical health and overall wellbeing," the 23-year-old singer posted overnight.

title.children: English pop star PinkPantheress cancels Australian tour, including Coldplay stadium shows

image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Officers are appealing for information as they try to understand how psychologist Frances Crawford, 49, died at her Queensland property.

title.children: Police investigate woman's suspicious death involving lawn mower

image.altText: Forensic officers near a small plane that has crashed in a field.

props.synopsis: After an inquest earlier this year, a Victorian coroner delivers his findings into a mid-air collision in 2020 between two planes in Mangalore, north of Melbourne.

title.children: Lack of communication between planes led to collision that killed four pilots, coroner finds

image.altText: Silouette of three workers on a ship standing by a hoisted large piece of machinery with horizon sunset in background.

props.synopsis: Mining companies hope to begin mining the sea floor for valuable metals soon — upping the stakes at a vote for the top role at the international regulator.

title.children: A high-stakes vote could decide the future of deep-sea mining

image.altText: Police carry boxes they have seized from a tobacco store.

props.synopsis: Health officials and police are cracking down the sale of illicit vapes, cigarettes and "chop chop" tobacco in Queensland. In the Wide Bay area alone sellers are estimated to have avoided paying about $1.2 million in tax.

title.children: Almost 500,000 black market cigarettes, 380kg of 'chop chop' seized in Queensland raids

image.altText: A close-up of a person's hands, wearing garden gloves and holding a handful of brown wood mulch.

props.synopsis: One of the easiest ways to show your garden some TLC is by mulching it. But what are the benefits of mulching, what varieties are available, and which ones are the best for your purposes?

title.children: Why mulch is good for your garden and the best types to use

image.altText: Cattle grazing on a vast, dry outback plain.

props.synopsis: An investment company owned by the Canadian government gets early approval to take over the debt-plagued Yeeda Pastoral Company.

title.children: One of the Kimberley's oldest cattle stations set to shift to Canadian ownership

image.altText: A photographer looks up while holding a lighting device at the Milky Way surrounded by leafless trees

props.synopsis: It might be chilly, but Australia's night sky puts on a dazzling show at this time of year — and this weekend is particularly good if you have clear weather. Rug up and use our guide to see if you can spot some of our winter wonders.

title.children: Australia gets a front-row seat to some of the best night skies in the world in winter
